javax.activity
Class ServiceInformation

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--javax.activity.ServiceInformation
public class ServiceInformation
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

An instance of a ServiceInformation object is used by each ServiceManager to identify the name of the high-level service and the context group to which a particular Activity belongs. This information is propagated as part of the org.omg.CosActivity.ActivityIdentity structure of the Activity service context, in the type_specific_data field, when the type field of the ActivityIdentity is set to 0x4A324545 to indicate a J2EE Activity.
The type_specific_data field is of type org.omg.CORBA.Any and, for a J2EE Activity type, contains a TypeCode with a TCKind of _tk_struct and a value of a j2ee_type_specific_data structure which is defined in IDL as follows: 

   struct j2ee_service_information
   {
     string service_name;
     string context_group;
     any service_specific_data;
   }
   struct j2ee_type_specific_data
   {
     struct j2ee_service_information;
     any extended_information;
   }

See Also:

Constructor Detail

ServiceInformation

public ServiceInformation(java.lang.String serviceName,
                          java.lang.String contextGroup,
                          org.omg.CORBA.Any serviceSpecificData)
Creates a ServiceInformation object to hold the contents of a org.omg.CosActivity.ActivityIdentity.type_specific_data when the org.omg.CosActivity.ActivityIdentity.type is set to 0x4A324545 to indicate a J2EE Activity.
This constructor is used by the Activity service prior to building a service context for an outbound request.
Parameters:
serviceName - The name used to identify the high-level-service (HLS) to which an Activity belongs. This name is the URL to which the associated ServiceManager is bound in JNDI.
contextGroup - The name of the context-group to which all Activities of the HLS belong.
serviceSpecificData - Non-architected data that is specific to a particular HLS implementation.

ServiceInformation

public ServiceInformation(org.omg.CORBA.Any typeSpecificData)
                   throws SystemException
Creates a ServiceInformation object to hold the contents of a org.omg.CosActivity.ActivityIdentity.type_specific_data when the org.omg.CosActivity.ActivityIdentity.type is set to 0x4A324545 to indicate a J2EE Activity.
This constructor is used by the Activity service after an inbound service context has been received, to construct a ServiceInformation object from the received type_specific_data.
Parameters:
typeSpecificData - A CORBA Any that contains a j2ee_service_information structure.
Throws:
SystemException - Thrown if the received org.omg.CosActivity.ActivityIdentity.type_specific_data is not in a recognized format for a J2EE Activity type.
Method Detail

getServiceName

public java.lang.String getServiceName()
Returns a String name that identifies the high-level-service (HLS). This name is the URL to which the associated ServiceManager is bound in JNDI.
Returns:
The JNDI name of the associated ServiceManager.

getContextGroup

public java.lang.String getContextGroup()
Returns the name of the context group to which all the ServiceManager's activities belong. This name is a String that different ServiceManagers use to identify a group to which their Activity contexts belong. By convention, a ServiceManager that does not intend its context to be managed cooperatively with transactions or another ServiceManager should use a ContextGroup name that is the same as the name of the service itself.
Returns:
The name of the context group that the ServiceManager's activities belong to. If no ContextGroup has been specified then this method returns null and the ServiceManager's activities belong to the default context group.

getServiceSpecificData

public org.omg.CORBA.Any getServiceSpecificData()
Returns a CORBA Any that contains information specific to the particular HLS ServiceManager.
Returns:
A CORBA Any that contains information specific to the HLS.

getTypeSpecificData

public org.omg.CORBA.Any getTypeSpecificData()
Returns a CORBA Any containing a j2ee_service_information structure representing the target object.
Returns:
A CORBA Any containing a j2ee_service_information structure.
